intro: Glottiphyllum armoedense, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, compact growth. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically green, with some varieties displaying red or purple hues. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or red, typically blooming in spring. This plant is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in mountainous regions with cool, moist conditions.
